title: Covid mRNA Vaccines Contributing To Deaths, Doctors Call For Suspension
content: Dr. Aseem Malhotra, a British Indian Consultant Cardiologist, has written an open letter to the General Medical Council (GMC) of the UK, stating that the vaccines cause greater harm than benefit.
summary: Dr. Aseem Malhotra, a British Indian Consultant Cardiologist, has written an open letter to the General Medical Council (GMC) of the UK, stating that the vaccines cause greater harm than benefit.

title: US Man Fatally Shoots Father, Injures Mother Over Household Argument
content: A 23-year-old man in the United States has been arrested for allegedly murdering his father and attempting to kill his mother in Bartow, Florida.
summary: A 23-year-old man in the United States has been arrested for allegedly murdering his father and attempting to kill his mother in Bartow, Florida.

title: Award-Winning US Poet Nikki Giovanni Dies Aged 81
content: Award-winning US poet Nikki Giovanni, who was at the forefront of the Black Arts Movement, died aged 81 after a long battle with cancer, local media reported Tuesday.
summary: Award-winning US poet Nikki Giovanni, who was at the forefront of the Black Arts Movement, died aged 81 after a long battle with cancer, local media reported Tuesday.

title: Former BBC Journalist Pleads Guilty To 35 Child Sex Abuse Offences
content: A former BBC journalist has been jailed for eight years for a string of child abuse offences, including paying money to watch live streams of children being sexually exploited in the Philippines.
summary: A former BBC journalist has been jailed for eight years for a string of child abuse offences, including paying money to watch live streams of children being sexually exploited in the Philippines.

title: Iran's Power Undiminished After Assad's Fall: Revolutionary Guards Commander
content: The commander of Iran's Revolutionary Guards said on Tuesday that the Islamic Republic had not been weakened following the fall of its ally Bashar al-Assad in Syria, Iranian media reported.
summary: The commander of Iran's Revolutionary Guards said on Tuesday that the Islamic Republic had not been weakened following the fall of its ally Bashar al-Assad in Syria, Iranian media reported.

title: AI Boom To Trigger Thousands Of Deaths, $20 Billion In Health Costs: Study
content: By 2030, this pollution could lead to 1,300 premature deaths annually in the US and public health costs of nearly $20 billion.
summary: By 2030, this pollution could lead to 1,300 premature deaths annually in the US and public health costs of nearly $20 billion.

title: Elon Musk's "Crazy" 1998 Prediction About Media's Future Now A Reality
content: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has shared an old video in which he predicted that the internet would "revolutionise traditional media".
summary: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has shared an old video in which he predicted that the internet would "revolutionise traditional media".

title: How Sundar Pichai's AI Vision Meshed With Elon Musk's Starship Ambitions
content: Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Alphabet, engaged with his Tesla counterpart Elon Musk after the announcement of Google's latest quantum computing advancement, Willow.
summary: Sundar Pichai, the CEO of Alphabet, engaged with his Tesla counterpart Elon Musk after the announcement of Google's latest quantum computing advancement, Willow.

title: MrBeast Reveals $14 Million City Built For New Reality Show 'Beast Games'
content: YouTuber Jimmy Donaldson, better known as MrBeast, has spent $14 million to construct a city for his upcoming game show, Beast Games.
summary: YouTuber Jimmy Donaldson, better known as MrBeast, has spent $14 million to construct a city for his upcoming game show, Beast Games.

title: How Fall Of Syria's Assad Exposed Limits Of China's Middle East Diplomacy
content: Just over a year ago, China gave Bashar al-Assad and his wife a warm welcome during their six-day visit to the country, offering the former Syrian leader a rare break from years of international isolation since the start of a civil war in 2011.
summary: Just over a year ago, China gave Bashar al-Assad and his wife a warm welcome during their six-day visit to the country, offering the former Syrian leader a rare break from years of international isolation since the start of a civil war in 2011.

title: Scientists Identify Gene Behind Orange Fur In Cats
content: After 60 years of research, scientists have discovered the gene responsible for orange fur in cats, finding that it is linked to a missing DNA segment that affects melanocyte-specific gene expression.
summary: After 60 years of research, scientists have discovered the gene responsible for orange fur in cats, finding that it is linked to a missing DNA segment that affects melanocyte-specific gene expression.

title: "Governor Trudeau Of State Of Canada": Trump Jibe Follows Tariff Warning
content: US President-elect Donald Trump has hit again after joking about making Canada the "51st state" of the US. This time, he has dubbed Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada, as "Governor", a post referring to the executive head of a US state.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump has hit again after joking about making Canada the "51st state" of the US. This time, he has dubbed Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada, as "Governor", a post referring to the executive head of a US state.

title: Syria Rebel Leader Discusses 'Transfer Of Power' After Assad's Fall
content: Assad fled Syria as the Islamist-led rebels swept into the capital, bringing an end on to five decades of brutal rule by his clan.
summary: Assad fled Syria as the Islamist-led rebels swept into the capital, bringing an end on to five decades of brutal rule by his clan.

title: 200 People Massacred In Haiti In An Attack Against Voodoo Practitioners
content: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres condemned the "horrific" violence, which his spokesman said left at least 184 people, including 127 elderly men and women, dead.
summary: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres condemned the "horrific" violence, which his spokesman said left at least 184 people, including 127 elderly men and women, dead.

title: Indian Students See 38% Drop In US Visas Issued From Jan To September 2024
content: The latest data from the US State Department shows there was a 38 per cent decline in F-1 student visas issued to Indian nationals in the first nine months of 2024 compared to the same period in the previous year.
summary: The latest data from the US State Department shows there was a 38 per cent decline in F-1 student visas issued to Indian nationals in the first nine months of 2024 compared to the same period in the previous year.

title: Europe Praises End Of Bashar Al-Assad's Rule But Is Anxious Too. Here's Why
content: European leaders have hailed the end of Bashar al-Assad's brutal rule in Syria as a moment of hope -- but they also view his sudden toppling as fraught with dangers.
summary: European leaders have hailed the end of Bashar al-Assad's brutal rule in Syria as a moment of hope -- but they also view his sudden toppling as fraught with dangers.

title: Papua New Guinea To Return To UN Climate Talks With Focus On "Forest"
content: Papua New Guinea's prime minister promised Tuesday to return to UN climate summits after boycotting this year's talks, but called for safeguarding forests to be a bigger priority.
summary: Papua New Guinea's prime minister promised Tuesday to return to UN climate summits after boycotting this year's talks, but called for safeguarding forests to be a bigger priority.

title: Criminals in UK Working From Home To Complete Community Sentences
content: Offenders completed community payback ordered by the courts by just clicking on web pages from the comfort of their homes or charity shops.
summary: Offenders completed community payback ordered by the courts by just clicking on web pages from the comfort of their homes or charity shops.

title: Opinion: You Must Outrage Over Filthy Air More Than Once A Year
content: Delhi welcomed us with monsoon rains and mangos. We were home. Fast forward a couple of years, in the winter of 2012, I found myself in denial about something other parents, mostly expats, were calling toxic air.
summary: Delhi welcomed us with monsoon rains and mangos. We were home. Fast forward a couple of years, in the winter of 2012, I found myself in denial about something other parents, mostly expats, were calling toxic air.

title: Secrets Of Palestinians' Nablus-Soap Making
content: UNESCO has recognised the thousand-year-old traditional practice of Nablus soap-making as an Intangible Cultural Heritage
